statements: CREATE TABLE InsurancePolicy (policy_id UUID PRIMARY KEY, policy_holder_name VARCHAR(100), policy_type VARCHAR(50), premium_amount DECIMAL(10, 2), start_date DATE, end_date DATE, is_active BOOL);
CREATE TABLE Customers (customer_id UUID PRIMARY KEY, customer_name VARCHAR(100), email VARCHAR(100), phone_number VARCHAR(15));
CREATE TABLE Claims (claim_id UUID PRIMARY KEY, policy_id UUID, claim_date DATE, claim_amount DECIMAL(10, 2), is_approved BOOL);
CREATE TABLE policy (policy_id INT PRIMARY KEY, policy_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, policy_holder_id INT NOT NULL, start_date DATE NOT NULL, end_date DATE NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE claim (claim_id INT PRIMARY KEY, policy_id INT NOT NULL, claim_date DATE NOT NULL, claim_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL, status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE PolicyHolder (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(50), age INT, policy_type VARCHAR(20), policy_amount DECIMAL);
CREATE TABLE InsuranceCompany (company_id UUID PRIMARY KEY, company_name VARCHAR(50), location VARCHAR(50), contact_number VARCHAR(15);
CREATE TABLE Policy (policy_id UUID PRIMARY KEY, holder_id UUID REFERENCES PolicyHolder(id), company_id UUID REFERENCES InsuranceCompany(company_id), start_date DATE, end_date DATE, premium DECIMAL);
CREATE TABLE Customers (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name STRING, email STRING, phone STRING)
CREATE TABLE Policies (id INT PRIMARY KEY, policy_number STRING, policy_type STRING, customer_id INT REFERENCES Customers(id)
CREATE TABLE Claims (id INT PRIMARY KEY, claim_number STRING, date DATE, amount FLOAT, customer_id INT REFERENCES Customers(id)
